Despair...
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Despair...
By DurahanDan on Friday, May 3, 2002 - 07:38 pm:

In raising a Zan i got far sight, all it does is "despair". So does pixie's element guard. But, what exactly does despair do?

By torey_luvullo on Saturday, May 4, 2002 - 05:42 am:

we do not know exactly. but one of my "vs data" pixies has element guard, and it seems to have the ability to make the opponent miss something that should have hit. when my pixie gets despair [which in my game is misspelled "dispair"] she sometimes can go through the entire match with it. unlike "addled" or "dizzy" it doesn't wear off on its own...it stays in effect until the opponent gets rid of it.

By DurahanDan on Saturday, May 4, 2002 - 07:35 am:

I also noticed that oppenents miss, it never disappears, and it is misspelled on my game(dispair),too. Atleast I know i'm not the only clueless one...

By Khift on Saturday, May 4, 2002 - 08:21 am:

I noticed once while fighting Radience that De(I)spair really hurt my hit and dodge %s. Other than that, I know as much as you do.

By newdragon on Saturday, May 4, 2002 - 10:08 am:

I fought Radiance last night and I had more speed than it but it used Element Guard 1 sec. into the match. My Durahan whose Stray Bolts rarely misses at lv.10 accuracy about 57-59(not sure) missed 3 times and Avalanch also missed 2 times. however the slower Radiance hit my Durahan eveery time. I reset and fought the Radiance again and it used Element Guard again early in the match. This time I attacked and missed and then it attacked and missed and lost dispair, unlike the first time when it kept it throughout the whole match as it did not miss.
This i think could lead to the answer of what dispair does. In my case as Khift said hurt my hit and dodge %s and makes the one who has dispair raise their hit and dodge %s.
I find this quite interesting as this is one of the only things anyone has yet to figure out and I would like to help solve this.
